text: Have been recently going here when I found out that thereâ€™s a thrift store they have a great assortment of items from clothes to household items prices are really good compared to other thrift stores in Singapore. The staff mostly volunteers are really nice and friendly and helpful especially Lin, Jean & Meghan they do go the extra mile with their service these volunteers do give and enjoyable experience when thrifting there. There are higher price items like gold and silver which you can ask to view definitely cheaper than outside and they do have good deals sometimes you can even find Tiffany & Co if you are lucky!
The place quite difficult to find for first timer, environment is pretty, dinings have to walk around 15mins. Bring umbrella if u can, no salter here.

Magnificent training there. I attended the Unit Specialist Programme (USP) in late August 2023 here by the Singapore Red Cross HQ. Although this may be an inconvenient place for you (because it is located quite far for me and first-timers), the instructors are friendly and they are helpful in guiding you to succeed. USP (To Teach & Inspire)

Came for 1st Aid course with Red Cross.  Instructor Jamal was very professional and thorough, highly recommended.  The environment is very peaceful around here, toilets are clean and there is a small canteen below to eat your own food if you brought your lunch.
Great place to service and learn. There is a bus service available from Kembangan MRT. Staff's are very respectful and knowledgeable. I strongly recommend this center.
